c74object.name: bach.read
c74object.description: Reads an llll from a file.

inlet.digest: Read to load an llll, bang to output it

method.name: (drag)
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains is stored and optionally output, according to the auto attribute.

method.name: bang
method.description: After an llll has been read, a bang causes it to be output.

method.name: read
method.description:
Syntax: read [<symbol: file_name>]
The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains is stored and optionally output, according to the auto attribute. If no file name is provided, a dialog box will open.

attribute.name: auto
attribute.description: When set to 1, the llll is automatically output immediately after being read from disk.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: lllls in text and native format can be read indifferently

entry.name: Inlet 1 (read/bang)
entry.description: Read to load an llll, bang to output it.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: lllls in text and native format can be read indifferently

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: read, load, disk, file, native, text.
